message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and Doing Business, we examine the relationship between electricity outages and business competitiveness in sub-Saharan African countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Doing Business"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses data from the LSMS-ISA Ethiopia Survey to investigate the impact of diversification on household welfare and resilience to extreme climate events.", "dataset": ["LSMS-ISA Ethiopia Survey"], "topic": ["Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use a combination of satellite imagery and administrative data from the Brazilian government to estimate the impact of land titling policies on deforestation rates in the Amazon rainforest.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery", "administrative data from the Brazilian government"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Drawing from multiple data sources such as LSMS-ISA, MICS, and DHS, this paper examines the impacts of rural electrification programs on gender-specific outcomes in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["LSMS-ISA", "MICS", "DHS"], "topic": ["Gender", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "This article analyzes the patterns and determinants of intra-Africa migration using data from the Gallup World Poll and Afrobarometer surveys from 2016 and 2018.", "dataset": ["Gallup World Poll", "Afrobarometer surveys"], "topic": ["Migration"]}, {"sentence": "To measure the effectiveness of public-private partnerships in the transportation sector in Latin America, we construct a novel dataset merging information on PPP projects from the IDB and World Bank databases.", "dataset": ["IDB", "World Bank databases"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Transport"]}, {"sentence": "We draw on data from the Global Findex and LSMS-ISA to investigate the relationship between financial inclusion and poverty reduction in sub-Saharan Africa, with a focus on mobile money services.", "dataset": ["Global Findex", "LSMS-ISA"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This paper analyzes the effects of extractive industries on local communities' well-being using data from the living standards measurement study conducted in Tanzania and Zambia.", "dataset": ["living standards measurement study conducted in Tanzania", "Zambia"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Combining multiple datasets including the World Development Indicators and the Global Energy Observatory, we estimate the efficiency of energy infrastructure investments in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "Global Energy Observatory"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using a combination of DHS and MICS data for Nigeria, Ghana, and Kenya, we examine how social protection programs can enhance nutritional outcomes among infants and young children.", "dataset": ["DHS", "MICS"], "topic": ["Social Protection", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "We use a panel dataset spanning over 20 years from the Mexican transport sector to estimate the effect of infrastructure investments on economic growth and employment opportunities in different regions of Mexico.", "dataset": ["panel dataset spanning over 20 years from the Mexican transport sector"], "topic": [ "Infrastructure", "Jobs & Development", "Regional Integration"]} ]
